15,http://www.armslist.com/posts/1972015,"For Sale:   Springfield Range Officer 1911 45ACP 5"" Target Sights","Las Vegas (15 & Russell), Las Vegas, Nevada",$ 787,"Listed On: Wednesday, August 7, 2013",Handguns,Springfield                                                                                ,45 ACP                                                                                ,Single Action                                                                                ,Pistol,"Model 1911-A1 Range Officer .45 ACP 5 Inch Stainless Steel Barrel Blued Slide Low Profile Adjustable Sights 7 Round

Designed for competitive shooting. Features a forged steel frame and slide. Five inch stainless steel barrel. Standard guide rod recoil system. Low Profile adjustable target sights. Long, lightweight speed (5-7 lbs) trigger. Full-length Cocobolo grips. Overall length is 8.5 inches.
PI9128LP “RANGE OFFICER”
Springfield Armory® has just introduced a new 1911 designed for
people interested in shooting competitively. It is called— The RO™,
“Range Officer™”. The RO™ is designed to give the shooter
exceptional quality, at an affordable price. One of the goals was to
create a pistol that is acceptable in many different styles of
shooting competitions, so the shooter can decide which one he
likes most. It is built with the same quality as the TRP™ and Trophy
Match™ models, but Springfield has removed the “extras” that result
in a higher price. It’s everything you need in a competition model,
at an affordable price, and easily upgradable for your future needs.
Available at Ventura Munitions on the SW Corner of Valley View and Russell. Call 8am-5pm Mon-Fri for more information or visit our firearms website at www.VenturaSupply.com
Available also for shipment for $15 Flat Rate."

Prices on trigger work on request, depending on the trigger. I also  have a way to make a huge improvement in Glock triggers with NO aftermarket parts. I have a sample you can dry fire to see if it's what you want. I work out of a shop in Greenwood and will meet you there for the inspection or to do work on your pistol.  Email me for references.
NRA basic pistol classes. Maximum of 4 student per class. You will learn proper safety procedures + proper stance, grip and trigger control for accurate shooting.
Certified Glock Armorer, NRA Certified basic pistol instructor."

THIS COMMERATIVE FIREARM PAYS TRIBUTE TO GENERAL GEORGE A CUSTER & THE SEVENTH CALVARY. BORN IN NEW RUMLEY, OHIO IN 1839, CUSTER MOVED TO MICHIGAN AS A CHILD AND LATER GRADUATED FROM WEST POINT MILITARY ACADEMY IN 1858.  CUSTER FOUGHT WITH THE UNION ARMY DURING THE CIVIL WAR AND WAS PROMOTED TO BRIGADIER GENERAL BY AGE 23.  AFTER THE CIVIL WAR, CUSTER COMMANDED CALVARY DIVISIONS IN THE WEST, HELPING TO KEEP ORDER DURING WESTWARD EXPANSION.  CUSTER AND THE US SEVENTH CALVARY FOUGHT IN THE BATTLE OF LITTLE BIGHORN, IN THE EASTERN MONTANA TERRITORY. ON JUNE 26, 1876 CUSTER WAS KILLED IN THE EPIC BATTLE.  ALONG WITH GENERAL CUSTER, OVER 300 OF HIS 700 MEN WERE KILLED, CAPTURED, OR INJURED, INCLUDING TWO OF GENERAL CUSTER'S BROTHERS, HIS NEPHEW, AND HIS BROTHER IN LAW.   THIS FIREARM COMMEMORATES THE SEVENTH CALVARY.
THIS IS A GREAT PIECE FOR THE COLLECTOR OF AMERICAN WEST MEMORABILIA"

436,http://www.armslist.com/posts/1972436,"For Sale:  IWI Tavor SAR-B16 Bullpup 5.56 16.5""","Colorado, Colorado, United States","$ 1,500","Listed On: Wednesday, August 7, 2013",Rifles,Israel Weapon Industries                                                                                ,223/5.56 NATO                                                                                ,Semi-automatic                                                                                ,Rifle,"This is a brand new in box IWI Tavor SAR-B16 bullpup rifle chambered in 5.56. The TAVOR is a perfect fusion of an ordnance grade steel receiver coupled to a Mil-Spec Cold Hammer Forged Chrome Moly Vanadium Chrome Lined barrel and encased into a high-impact strength polymer uni-body with exceptional situational ergonomics. The ultra-compact form factor allows for easy transitions in close quarter situations. The bullpup design moves the center of gravity of the rifle closer to the users’ body allowing for more instinctive aiming and improved acquisition time to target. This innovative design also allows for a full length barrel, which means no loss of down range ballistic accuracy. Near and far range accuracy is enhanced by the minimized recoil provided by a non-lubricated long stroke gas piston system. With the exception of a hand-specific locking bolt, the rifle is completely ambidextrous allowing for easy left-hand conversion of the operating handle, ejection port, fire-control safety, sling swivel receptacles and fore-mounted accessory Picatinny rail. The TAVOR is supplied with IDF-tested and approved magazines – but you can also use your own AR-15/M16 style magazines.

Adjustable back-up sights are integrated and can be folded down in to the Picatinny rail, and the front post is Tritium for improved visibility. All metal parts are treated for corrosion resistant. A rubber butt pad is integrated in to the stock to reduce felt recoil. The Tavor is assembled in the USA from US and Israeli manufactured parts.
Caliber: 5.56mm NATO
Capacity: One 28 round magazine included
Barrel: 16.5"" Cold Hammer Forged, Chrome Lined, Chrome Moly Vanadium barrel, 1:7"" twist
Overall Length: 26.1""
Weight (unloaded): ~7.9 pounds"

488,http://www.armslist.com/posts/1972488,For Sale/Trade:  vz. 24 8mm Mauser,"Southeast Louisiana, New Orleans, Louisiana",$ 500,"Listed On: Sunday, August 25, 2013",Rifles,Mauser                                                                                ,8mm Mauser                                                                                ,Bolt Action                                                                                ,Rifle,"This is a 1940 Czech vz. 24. Manufactured in Czechoslovakia at the Brno factory for the Germans during World War II This rifle was made from the Mauser M98 design and was issued to Romanian Axis forces, and most likely saw action in the Ukraine and Stalingrad before being put into storage after collection from the Romanian Communist government.

This rifle is chambered to shoot the 8mm Mauser (7.92x57) cartridge, and can hold 5+1 rounds with an internal magazine. The rifle is in fair to good shape, the action functions smoothly and the bore is in decent condition with good rifling.
Please note, the bolt's serial (not pictured) does NOT match the rifle's serial number. I would assume this was done post-war but cannot confirm any information about it.

I am asking for $500, or best offer including trade offers. Thanks for viewing, feel free to message me with any questions or offers! Buyer must be 18 years of age or older, present a valid Louisiana driver's license or state ID, and sign a bill of sale, no exceptions."

Up for sale is one, new in the box IWI Tavor bullpup rifle in 5.56 NATO/.223 Rem caliber. The TAVOR® is a perfect fusion of an ordnance grade steel receiver coupled to a Mil-Spec cold hammer forged barrel and encased into a high-impact strength polymer uni-body with exceptional situational ergonomics. The ultra-compact form factor allows for easy transitions in close quarter situations…or even in your favorite deer blind. The bullpup design moves the center of gravity of the rifle closer to the users’ body allowing for more instinctive aiming and improved acquisition time to target. This innovative design also allows for a full length barrel, which means no loss of down range ballistic accuracy. Near and far range accuracy is enhanced by the minimized recoil provided by a non-lubricated long stroke gas piston system. With the exception of a hand-specific locking bolt, the rifle is completely ambidextrous allowing for easy left-hand conversion of the operating handle, ejection port, fire-control safety, sling swivel receptacles and fore-mounted accessory Picatinny rail. The TAVOR® is supplied with IDF-tested and approved magazines – but you can also use your own AR-15/M16 style magazines. **Stock: BLACK** Caliber: 5.56 NATO** Barrel Length: 16 1/2** Weight (lbs):7.9** Overall Length: 26 1/8** Bullpup configuration; short rifle convenience with long rifle accuracy. Mil-Spec , chrome lined, cold-hammer forged CrMoV barrel, 6 groove 1:7 RH twist. 100% ambidextrous configuration and operation with optional left hand bolts for 5.56 NATO and 5.45x39mm. Integral folding adjustable backup iron sights with Tritium front post (flat top models only) Integral ambidextrous front and rear quick detachable sling swivel receptacles. Simple field stripping into easily serviceable subassemblies. Mil-Std 100% interchangeability of all TAVOR®SAR parts. Uses standard AR-15/M16 magazines. Last round hold open on empty magazine. All metal parts are treated for corrosion resistance. Integral rubber recoil pad. Assembled in the US from Israeli and US manufactured parts. Optimized ergonomic design for increased comfort and ease of use. Clean, long stroke piston operation. Body constructed of high-strength impact modified polymer."

Remington 700 .223 rifle. I bought this gun brand new last fall, and have fired exactly 40 rounds through it in one range session.
-Remington 700 SPS Varmint .223 Rem. BDL setup (hinged floorplate), matte finished metal.  Model # is 84215 26"" bull barrel, 1-12"" twist rate.  X-Mark Pro trigger.
From Remington.com:
Overview:

“Why yes, that’s really five shots.” Tell your friends it’s genetics. Fact is, when it comes to precision, there’s no finer pedigree in the industry than Remington® varmint rifles. And with the introduction of our new Model 700™ SPS™ Varmint, staking claim to our legendary accuracy is a more attainable feat than ever.
The Model 700™ SPS™ Varmint is capable of punching tiny groups straight out of the box because it’s built on the Model 700™ action, the most solid, dependable and trusted in existence.

The ergonomically designed black synthetic stock has a vented beavertail fore-end for enhanced grip, reduced weight and better heat dissipation. And sharp predator eyes won’t spot the tough, non-reflective matte blued finish on the barrel and receiver. Other standard features include a hinged floorplate magazine, sling swivel studs, and a drilled and tapped receiver. The Model 700™ SPS™ Varmint is destined to leave a lasting impression on any varmint that crosses its line of sight.
Key Features:
Newly designed SPS Varmint stock with vented beavertail fore-end
Sling swivel studs included
26"" heavy-contour barrel (0.820"" muzzle O.D.)
Legendary Model 700™ action
Drilled and tapped for scope mounts
This gun is close to a new gun as you could get without buying it new.
I'm happy to take additional pictures at your request or answer any questions.
Happy to ship this gun to the buyer's FFL at the buyer's expense (contact me with your zip code if you need a shipping quote).
Will trade (locally) for 12 20 28 or 410 target loads (factory only, no reloads), 20 28 or 410 wads, 12 20 28 or 410 once fired AA or STS hulls, lead shot (7.5 or smaller) or shotshell primers.
NOT looking to trade for other guns, or anything else that isn't listed above."

760,http://www.armslist.com/posts/1972760,For Sale:  ITHACA LE FEVER NITRO SPECIAL - GOTTA SEE IT!!!,"MIDTOWN, Houston, Texas",$ 500,"Listed On: Saturday, September 7, 2013",Shotguns,Ithaca                                                                                ,12 Gauge                                                                                ,Side by Side                                                                                ,Shotgun,"Ok, here’s one for you double gun collectors. This is a LeFever Nitro Special that got crossed with a Western Field special order at the Ithaca factory. It has WESTERN FIELD DELUXE & MONTGOMERY WARDS & CO. on the barrels. It has two of the few options available with the Western Field guns: dual bead sights and a soft rubber butt pad. The only other option was the ejector that came later.

Now, here’s where the anomalies come in. None of the Western Field guns frames were case hardened, this one was. There are traces of case hardening color under the front of the trigger guard, and on the top tang. The Western Field guns had a setter at point stamped into the frame sides. This one has the LeFever Nitro Special Duck in the Swamp scene. It has serial numbers matching on the frame, for end and barrels that are consistent with a LeFever Nitro Special made in 1929. The serial numbers are not even in the Western Field range. The Western Field guns stocks were not checkered and were not normally good Walnut, the stocks on this gun are checkered and have a bit of natural tiger striping in the walnut.
This is a VERY unusual gun. It’s in an unadulterated form and in perfect functioning condition.

The bores are pristine. Both of the sighting beads have been broken. Bluing on the barrels is excellent with a very few minor surface scratches. The Duck in the Swamp scenes are light, but distinguishable. They aren’t worn, just lightly stamped. The frame is dark, but there is no indication that it has been blued.
The barrels are 12 Ga., 30” choked full and modified.
Here’s your opportunity to own a true Ithaca mix up gun…
Price is $500.00 cash picked up in Midtown Houston. I will ship to your FFL for $35.00. I can send more photos if you are seriously interested.
REDACTED"

788,http://www.armslist.com/posts/1972788,"For Sale:  BERETTA 92 SERIES 92S, LIKE 92FS, 90-TWO, M9 TRITIUM NIGHT SIGHTS","Summerville / Mt. Pleasant / Charleston, Charleston, South Carolina",$ 540,"Listed On: Saturday, August 31, 2013",Handguns,Beretta USA                                                                                ,9mm Luger (9x19)                                                                                ,Double / Single Action                                                                                ,Pistol,"Price is Firm. Paypal Okay (Credit Cards Okay).  Ships for $30 to FFL.
For Sale:  Beretta 92s, MADE IN ITALY.
Lots of Extras including 2 Magazines and Brand new Holster.

Includes Brand new Fixed Tritium Night Sights professionally installed (150 bucks for sights and $30 for installation).  These night sights glow bright green all the time, and can only be seen by the shooter, not the target.

This is a precursor to the M9 (civilian 92fs).  This pistol was made in the early 1980s, collectors are going nuts for these since they are the real deal, original 9mm Beretta 92 series pistols, Italian craftsmanship, always imitated but Never Duplicated.

The 92s is the pistol that was tested by US Special Forces when the Military decided to go with the 9mm pistol.  This one is the original, with the mag release near the bottom of the pistol grip before it was changed in the subsequent models.  The M9 and the 92fs both have the Mag Release in a different position near the top of the mag well near the trigger.    It’s the style used by European Special forces and police officers for decades; also the type exported to the US in the weapon’s early inception.  Of course, it shoots and handles just like the 92fs, but it’s more collectible, and, in my humble opinion, a little finer craftsmanship.
Includes:
(already installed professionally by a local gunsmith)

column2: Brand New Uncle Mike’s ambidextrous shoulder holster
2 magazines.  One is standard mag, the other is double stacked so it holds more rounds

column1: Credit cards accepted. Shipping to FFL okay.
Selling off most of my guns and ammo, so check my other listings.  Thank You."
